data.formatted_address: Japan, 〒874-8666 Oita, Beppu, Higashiyama, 城島高原１２３
data.name: Kijima Kogen Park

reviews.text:
Experience is never-ending, this place is foreign-tourist friendly (based on my experience), some staff able to explain how to play in english. Heartwarming, good food, affordable free pass. If I have any chance I would like to go again.
The most memorable ride was the wooden rollercoaster jupiter and the newton drop 🎢

Can occupy the whole day. 1500 yen for entrance fee for adult. If u wanna play the rides , U have to pay extra 4300yen pass or pay per ride (cost around 300-1000yen depending on which ride).
Worth going.
Had a great time here with my sons. Weekdays there are no lines anywhere in the park. If you can do it definitely head over on a weekday!

We've been a couple times...last visited in 2009. Both times we went during the weekday during the school year so the park was basically deserted. The surroundings are very beautiful and the park is nice, the rides fun. The kids are no longer kids so we'll never go back but running around the empty park is still a great memory.
A small amusement park that is fun, clean, well maintained, and friendly staff. Price is quite high for what it offers.

It's pretty far out from anywhere, or at least it seemed that way to me, driving in from Honshu. It was a quint, if tiny little attraction area. They had an owl aviary and a cat "zoo." I visited neither. There was a small area to feed goats and guinea pigs, but the highlight for me was the squirrel enclosure. Dozens of shops to poke around in, but they're all playhouse sized, and you'll probably see everything there is to see within an hour. There are more shops and food stalls outside the Floral Village, but they're pretty standard tourist trap fare.

We only visited for a day trip !
It was beautiful and refreshing as we were the only Australians as I could see there !  Very sweet place but also high impact of tourists extremely! Lots shops not a lot of flowers really  lacked the charm of flowers to me it was a beautiful region but again a very high impact of tourism.

Be sure to come on time! If you’re first, you get to experience the full beauty of this place. It’s a rather small town (10 min loop) You should spam photos at the start and slowly head your way down. Lots of furry animals and optional for you to pay and feed them!

We absolutely loved this village!

It’s pretty small and only known for the beautiful fairytale architecture. Good for a photo or two. The streets are packed in the afternoon but if you come in the morning it is less packed. Some small shops, cat cafe, owl cafe and animal exhibits (though the condition doesn’t look very good 😔)

Yufuin is a beautiful and quant little city nestled in the mountains of the Oita Prefecture. When you get off the train and walk through the station your first view of Main Street takes you back to a little mountain village. I loved the shopping we did as we meandered our way up to the floral village. Lots of great restaurants, coffee shops and bakeries.  Once you reach the Floral Village it is everything that you have seen posted on Instagram. You wind through a maze of little gift shops filled with Ghibli trinkets. Being up in the mountains it was a nice cool break from Tokyo. My only warning is that this area has many Instagram photo spots and so you are constantly trying to maneuver around people trying to get the perfect picture. I highly recommend making this a destination on your trip to Japan.

data.formatted_address: Japan, 〒879-5102 Oita, Yufu, Yufuinchō Kawakami, ３００１−８ NAYA1・２F
data.name: Trick 3D Art Yufuin

reviews.text: It’s a bit overpriced compared to the ones in Korea, which are 5x bigger, and just a tad more expensive. They do however have ways to set your phone up if there’s no one to help you out and you want your whole group. I did appreciate the idea photos in the floor, however the lighting was a constant struggle and not great to get real looking photos. But, all in all a fun 30 min experience.
Fun and worth it! Some of our best holiday pictures were taken here.
A fun place to take some funny trick art photos. They periodically change the 3-D art so there is always a chance to revisit this place.
It is good but doesn't worth the trip or the fee
A little cramped but still a fun experience.

We visited late Nov 23.
It was so pretty in the morning. The steam from the hot water created a mist floating just on the surface. Along with the blue sky and autumn leaves.
Kinda very busy when we were there though

The water is pretty clear and you can see the fishes swimming around. It is a small lake, so it takes about 30 mins.to complete a round to take photos at various angles. The one with the mountain is the best 👍

While the view was spectacular, it was pretty much an “okayyyy let’s goo” moment.

However, would recommend shopping around the area nearby. Tons of interesting shops/cafe/restaurants to see and dine.

Came on a Wednesday afternoon and it was a bit crowded with tourists. The lake was smaller than expected, and the water was ripply so I couldn’t catch the reflective scenic moment! Highly suggest those who plan to visit to come in early morning for a quieter and better view, as recommended by others.
The lake is very beautiful, with a view of the mountains. There are many restaurants around. We chose a famous soba restaurant.  Sitting and eating while looking at the garden was very happy

A must do in Yufuin for savoury delights & sweet treats! Literally, you can walk, eat & browse the stores along the way! Full of tourists but managed to wait for breaks to capture a few shots! Enjoy the cu-cu-chi cafe garden & their duck soba too! Make sure you plan a full day to allow time to enjoy the streets & treats!

The first name was "Yufuin", and later "Yufuin Town" and "Yupira Town" were merged into "Yufuin Town".
"Buyuan", both of these names are now called by some people. This place is surrounded by mountains and has charming scenery.
It is one of the favorite attractions for many foreign travelers.
Yunotsubo Street in Yufuin is also full of artistic atmosphere. In addition to famous art museums,
Gathering more than 50 shops, including restaurants, cafes, dessert shops and art shops, among which
Including popular famous stores: Snoopy Tea House, Hayao Miyazaki Store, Miffy Bunny Bakery, YUFUIN
FLORAL VILLAGE, where you can enjoy the unique scenery of Yufuin

I went to Yunotsubo Street.
A variety of products were lined up, and cute items and new stores were lined up.
Many tourists enjoyed sightseeing here.

Because it was the weekend, there were a lot of people.
Cute prop shops, alleys like a European fairy tale village,
There were many shops, including cafes and bakeries.
There are a lot of food stalls selling food so I looked around.
It was good to taste.
Fun watching people, fun looking at props and shops,
The fun of eating delicious food^^
Well-made tourist destination^^

Yufuin Street has a lot to offer along the way.
Lots of cute accessories, dolls, dolls, and supplies
People who love Hayao Miyazaki can't miss it
Jinlin Lake, when the sun shines in the morning, the lake is sparkling and beautiful.

This is a nice canyon. Unfortunately it rained on the day we went and we were the only people there.

You have to walk down couple hundred steps down to the base of the canyon. It’s take 5-10 minutes to get down so it wasn’t bad. Coming back up was more tiring obviously. It may be difficult for elderly people.

It costs 100 yen to get in and the lady at the booth was very friendly.

Nice to go, not a must but recommended.
Beautiful place and area! Hard to reach (only by car) but definitely recommend since there are barely any tourists!

From the main entrance, the trail down to the river bed is closed due to damage from earth quake. The other trail to the North is still open. This is as accurate as Aug 2015. Please verify with the tourist office when you visit.

The place is very nice and a lot of activities can be done but unfortunately it was closed when we visited due to landslide but the employee in the ticket counter was very nice and gave us some free postcards and said it would be open again spring 2019. Hope to visit again when its open.
Love this canyon

data.formatted_address: Japan, 〒879-5102 Oita, Yufu, Yufuinchō Kawakami, ２９９５−１ 休館日は隔週水曜日です
data.name: COMICO ART MUSEUM YUFUIN

reviews.text: Tucked away from the high street, this hidden gem requires advance reservation in its website. Featuring selected artworks from some of the greatest Japanese contemporary artists (and one of my favourite being Yoshitomo Nara), this art museum showcases an impressive architectural design by Kengo Kuma. Together with the museum’s traffic control policy (hence the advanced booking), I could truly enjoy my time in the art museum! Truly one of the best art appreciation experiences!

reviews.author_name: Chelsea Pun (思思賢 Chill My Babe)
reviews.text: COMICO ART MUSEUM YUFUIN is a must-visit destination for anyone interested in contemporary Japanese art. As soon as I stepped inside, I was captivated by the powerful yet whimsical works of Yayoi Kusama, Takashi Murakami, and others. The museum's harmonious integration with the natural beauty of Yufuin's mountains created an incredibly serene and inspiring atmosphere. Wandering through the galleries, I was continuously awed by the artists' unique perspectives and technical mastery. The chance to see large-scale installations like Yoshitomo Nara's "Your Dog" on the second-floor platform was a particular highlight. Overall, this museum offers a truly immersive and unforgettable experience. Highly recommended for art enthusiasts and nature lovers alike!

Beautiful museum. The architecture from Kengo Kuma reminds the Nezu museum in Tokyo. The artworks from Kusama, Sugimoto, Murakami among others are worth seeing.
while the city can be crowded by tourists , not so much for this museum

A small but amazing museum, with collections of signature artpieces from the famous modern artists.  As the numbers of guests of each timeslot is controlled, u can really enjoy the art-pieces.  U can see mount yufu on the rooftop.  It is recommended to buy the ticket online as it has discount and it indicates the available timeslot.

Such a fantastic gem in the middle of all the hustle.
Great architecture and beautiful display of contemporary art pieces.

data.formatted_address: Japan, 〒874-0000 Oita, Beppu, Minamitateishi, 字寒原１０−７
data.name: Beppu Ropeway

reviews.text:
Went up on a Tuesday. There were not many people. Weather was cloudy so the view was not clear. Saw two deers on the way up! The ride was not scary, not shaky too. The ride is 10 minutes with a Japanese guide on board.

Not many parking lots outside the station, but there is a bigger one just down the road.

We went on a weekday, it wasn’t crowded and we had a nice hike to the top of the mountain.
Wear comfortable shoes and bring a jacket even if it’s summer or end spring.

It does get really cold especially when the wind blows. View is great especially when u get to the top!

You'll have to get really lucky to get the clear and picturesque views some other people have posted, as I suspect clouds and fog like we got are much more common. That said, this was still very enjoyable and it did clear up a bit on top to get some nice views. The walk around at the top was pretty on its own too.

Worth going but do note that there is a climbers only trail. Quite a challenge but do try if you are adventurous. Wear good shoes with support if you decide to use that trail. People with altitude sickness beware as I seen some people vomiting.

The Beppu Ropeway is Kyushu's largest ropeway.  Located in Beppu, Oita Prefecture.  By the distance to see the view while riding the cable car  It is 1,816 meters long and has an altitude of approximately 1,300 meters above sea level.  Tourists can ride the ropeway to view the beauty of Mount Tsurumi all year round.  And enjoy watching the scenery from above.  You can see the city and Beppu Bay as well.  If you go in the spring, you will be able to see the beauty of the cherry blossoms in full bloom.  If you go during the fall, you will see the leaves slowly changing color along the mountainside.  And if you go during the winter, the weather will be cooler and you may encounter snow on the high mountains.  Or snowflakes scattered all over the ground.  Each season has its own uniqueness and natural beauty.
Well worth the visit if you are near.  Being a picnic or snack and if it’s hot out maybe even a good place to cool off!

A park located in the Yufu River Gorge.
It is a park with a suspension bridge where you can walk around.

However, there is no way to go down into the valley, and the view from the suspension bridge is no longer as spectacular as the trees have grown.

reviews.author_name: 福田平八郎が左手で書いたマトリョーシカ
reviews.text: During the season, you can see beautiful kudzu flowers that have grown thicker than the ropes on the suspension bridge. I'm very impressed.

Visited on September 8, 2022
There weren't many information boards, and we finally arrived. Not many people came.
Please donate 100 yen before entering.
It was grassy all the way to the suspension bridge❗
But I'm glad I went

It's quite a valley and looks good for activities. I don't recommend going on days before or after it rains a little. This is because there are natural dangers. They are focusing on it as a parking lot and tourist spot, and the locals say it's beautiful during the cherry blossom season, so they recommend it.
Great View
Love this nature.

reviews.author_name: こんにちはあかちゃんお星様
reviews.text:
There are times when I don't want to leave the foot of Mt. Yufu just yet.
At times like these, you can take a nice 400m walk.
The path was easy to walk, quiet, and the cherry blossoms were beautiful.
Yufudake is cool, isn't it?
All of the mountains in Oita were full of scenery that I had never seen before, and it left a lasting impression on me.

It came into the navigation system, so I stopped by! ️The scenery was nice because it was an observation point, but it wasn't the season when the flowers were blooming, so it felt lonely as a promenade park.
There is ample parking space and a well-maintained walking path. A little-known spot overlooking Sagiridai.

The actual pond has amazing clear water bubbling up constantly from underneath within the rocks. Bring your water bottle and fill up!

What's even more impressive about this place is the forest walk you take up over a hill and through an old forest to reach the pond.

Entrance fee of ¥100, free parking walking distance away. Due to 2020 typhoon and heavy rain, the hiking trail after the spring area is closed off. I swear this is the best water I have ever consumed in my life.

Short walk to the spring.  Super clear water. Interesting trees with roots growing over giant boulders.  There must be a path to the waterfalls but maybe it was closed (?).. too bad there's no English sign . But u can drive to the waterfalls too, just further along 621.
The big tree with the restaurant beside the spring is very eye-catching green
Nice little spring. Totally deserted in winter. Also no one to collect the fees.

The receptionist was obsessed with us washing our hands in alchohol and wanted masks worn as she. Covid!! I’m not sure there is a single piece of stained glass that is not a copy , made in Japan . Of an overseas glass window , dissapoined
Please visit this place! Due to pandemic it seems it doesn't have much visitors but the place is beautiful and the workshop offers a great experience. The staff is very nice and kind.
A small museum that gives a little bit silent time for myself

Although it is a little far away, there is a parking lot and it is convenient.
I went there on a Sunday morning and it was raining, so there weren't many other tourists, so it was nice to be able to explore in peace.

A house first? After viewing the exhibits in each room on the first and second floors, you can look towards the church.

In the detached house, there were various things to suit the concept of each room.

When you enter the church, you can admire the stained glass windows in the back, left and right, looking up from below with natural light.

It was so beautiful that I wanted to take pictures, but I was disappointed that I couldn't take pictures in all the places.

It is Japan's first antique stained glass museum.
I was attracted by the splendid exterior and entered the building.
The admission fee is 1,080 yen for adults, and you can view the museum next door.
From the front, the museum is on the left and the association is on the right.
Inside the dimly lit interior, you will find many accessories made with stained glass for sale.
It's relatively expensive, but I guarantee you'll be healed. ( lol )

The stained glass displayed in each room was created between the 1800s and 1900s and was collected from various countries in Europe.
There are mainly religious paintings, and the illuminated pieces match the antique furniture, creating a fantastic atmosphere.
The adjacent association is furnished with period furniture, and the central stained glass window is illuminated by natural light and stands out beautifully.
It can be a little cold in winter.
We recommend taking measures against the cold.
It seems that it can also be used for weddings, so if you are interested in a solemn wedding ceremony, why not visit?
Tranquil museum with a cafe and store. There’s a comfy library at the back of the museum to sit and read.

The small gallery owned by Murata Showa , and they offer the hotel guests for Free entrance. Several nice works of Japanese artists and a small library upstair and this is worth enough to spend your 2 hours here. Recommended.

A small but charming art gallery located to the east to Yufuin. In fact, The whole neighbourhood is like an artistic community, with different types of art museums, galleries, cafes, shops, restaurants, etc. You can spend your whole afternoon here just walking and browsing the entire community. The gallery itself is spacious and well designed. Parking available.

The museum is too small to warrant the entrance fee.  However, if you consider the entire area surrounding the museum as your destination like a cafe, it’s worth a hike up the hill.  The museum is pretty and quiet; it’s just underwhelming to be considered as a sole destination.  Unfortunate.

Way better and less touristy than Marc Chagall - such a tranquil and hidden gem; well worth of 25 minutes climbing uphill in pouring rain. Very modern and well maintained - staff is exceptionally friendly. Highly recommend.

While driving home from Beppu station, we happened to stop by here to take a break and eat some snacks. The view in this place is truly fantastic, plus they also have horses and a cute llama named Kurori. If you have spare time, I suggest stopping by this place.

The is the free parking lot you must stop by. Input GPS navigation to mapcode 46 301 725*70. There is one shop and small toilet (smelly) The best thing is you have an outstanding valley overlook of Yufuin.

You can see the entire town from here. The view at daytime is good, but that in the morning is more beautiful. You can see morning dew covering the whole town. That view is very fantastical and worth seeing.

From this view you can see yufuin city. On your way to yufuin make sure to stop here and enjoy the view before arriving there.

Free parking, vending machine available to grab drink.
Lovely lookout above yufuin, with free parking and a small store.

On the way from Yufuin city to Aso, we stop by this observatory spot. There is a couple parking lots along Yamanashi highway. We walk up 30 meters to observation deck and enjoy view of Yufuin city, Mout Yufu.
Great views over Yufuin. Well worth stopping if you're going past
Incredible views that should end up on every nearby camera and memory. Great perspective of how Yufuin is nestled against the volcano. Covered area available in case of a rain storm or hot sun.
great view. few steps up. something to do when in Yufuin.

Visited in the afternoon, there was fog in the mountains so did not get a clear view. The photos posted by the other travellers were great though. I guess the early morning is a better time to visit. Next time!
In some seasons, you can see fireflies if you visit at night, but I came at noon^^
It's just a normal bridge with stairs.

reviews.author_name: ジャック“チャッピー”パパ
reviews.text:
disillusionment
Many tourists come to Yufuin with their pets, but this riverside road off Yunotsubo Kaido is covered in feces everywhere. It's so hard to even walk. It's not Yunotsubo Kaido, it's like U○ko Kaido. The image of Yufuin has become quite bad.

Because it has a mixture of steps and curved surfaces,
Avoid tripping and falling, especially at night.
Please be careful when crossing.

Visited on 6/17
It seemed to be late in the season, so there was no light from the fireflies at all. . .
It was said that if the timing was right enough to give the bridge its name, it would be a spectacular sight to see, but unfortunately the timing seemed to have been missed.
I came here for sightseeing and took a 20 minute walk from where I was staying, but all I could see was two lights at Yufumi Bridge in the foreground. Yufumibashi and Hotarukanbashi are also said to be firefly spots, so I thought I'd like to go back there someday.
I didn't see any fireflies, but I think it was a luxurious time after soaking in the hot springs and walking around the area!

A very very beautiful place to watch the Yufuin valley as well as the Mt Yufu . The marvelous scenery was not able to be described by words . Have to come here to experience! A place worthy to pay a visit again again and again especially in different seasons.
Amazing . Trust me .not everyone knows about that place . But it’s the best place to see Yufuin valley . You will get totally different landscape.summer is best time to visit .

Very beautiful, but the road is narrow. You should go during the time when there are not many people, such as in the morning or evening. If you take a sedan, you may have to be careful because some sections are very narrow. There are times when you can make a U-turn but you have to be very careful. Unfortunately, when I went I thought I had arrived, but actually this point is a little further from the parking area. Makes the view slightly different Most of the people who come to take photos drive motorcycles. It seems like it's still a secret spot. But the way from Yufuin City to this point is very beautiful. Driving down the road, there is a very beautiful view.

When I visited last December, Mt. Yufu was brown, so I revisited it this time.
It's been half a year since then, and Mt. Yufu, which has turned fresh green, is absolutely beautiful.
However, as others have posted, the road is narrow and it seems difficult to make a U-turn.
Therefore, if you have a heavy vehicle such as a car or motorcycle, it is better to be prepared to some extent.
Is it good? think.

I was informed that the road was narrow and it would be difficult to make U-turns, so I parked my car at the free parking lot at the Mt. Yufu trailhead and walked back and forth for about 20 minutes each way.
It's hard to tell from the photo, but you can see the dynamic Mt. Yufu even while walking.
The observation deck on the slope is a good place to view Yufu city.
Well, I measured the width of the road and it was about 3.5 to 3.7 meters, and there were 3 to 4 evacuation areas, so it was generally safe for light vehicles to pass each other. It will be difficult for cars with 3 numbers and large cars.
By the time I returned to the parking lot on March 1, 2024 with some snow remaining, I was sweating and got a good workout.

data.formatted_address: Mount Yufu, Yufuincho Kawakami, Yufu, Oita 879-5102, Japan
data.name: Mount Yufu

reviews.text: Nice & quiet Saturday summer hike. Relaxed climb up to the 'Y-junction' in between the two mountains with a fair bit of rock scrambling with metal chains nearing summit. Amazing view once the clouds cleared.
Took me about 4 hours to hike up the east peak and return, amazing landscape. The path is clear and many locals during weekend, so you won’t be alone.

The climb up Mount Yufu from the carpark at the base took us approximately 5 hours (up and down). We definitely were not prepared for the snow. However, that said, the climb itself was very manageable. The journey itself was beautiful, the change in the environment as you ascend and the nature surrounding the pathway is indescribably beautiful. That took all the pain away from the hike.

Watch out for loose rocks near the top. Combined with the snow, it led to a lot of near miss falls.

Nice hike. Couldn't see slot due to rain and clouds, but the hike was fun.
Make sure to wear proper shoes! Also if you are not to confident in your climbing skills the top might be too dangerous on rainy days.

No car and we didn't know there's a bus available to bring us there, so we walked 4 miles from where we stayed to the trailhead to start the hike. It was foggy yesterday, and the trail has lots of switchbacks filled with rocks. At the split where you can choose to take the west or east peak or both, we chose the west peak. The Fogg makes the chains slippery, but after risking the fall to breaking your bones or dead, it all worth it to make it to the top. The only thing that can make this better is the weather. Foggs and clouds covered everything that you can see. But yeah, we make it. But not want to do it again soon.

Ticket vending machine at front door, 800yen per person.
There're some personal collections, 2nd floor had one of McLaren mp4/5 replica.There're one Fiat and one Bus were allowed to have a seat inside to enjoy old school drive.
Kids and car guys may enjoy here. Suggest to reserve 30-min or more to visit here.

Visited this Retro Motor Museum on new year holiday. Recommended for those who like old and antique cars, bikes, and other old school’s related things. Entrance fee is ¥800 for adult, and ¥400 for child.
Great for vintage car owners!
Must for car / bike geeks!! Spent hours pouring over each piece, many rare items
Interesting place. Went on the day it's close. 🙄

I now understand why the stellar reviews. We had the most relaxing and enjoyable stay. Each individual cottage is private and different themed. Ours had an inner and outer private bath. Lots of amenities for the ladies in the washroom and different tea, coffee and cold drinks for free in the room. The view from the living room was also spectacular.

Kaiseki dinner was impressive and very filling. I was surprised by the all you can drink menu offering lots of different alcohol and non-alcoholic options. Breakfast was delicious.

I felt fully cared for by the staff during my one night stay. They made sure your experience is memorable and comfortable.

very relaxing environment 🛏️💤
There are air conditioners in the rooms,so no need to worry about the temperature 😉
Receptionists are patient and intimate ,they introduce your dinner one by one!!!🍱🍣🍲
While you check out,you can ask them for a taxi to go to the yufuin train station ,and it is free 🆓 ！

Stayed here for a night - food, service and room are absolutely amazing.  Personally think that it’s good price for value.  Especially love the creativity of the chef- dinner was delicious traditional food presented in a creative way.

The onsen was nice and the service was amazing.  When we checked out, the taxi was fully booked so a lovely female staff took us to the bus station with her own car.  Would definitely come back again!

Unforgettable experience. Thoroughly enjoyed a luxurious stay for 2 nights at this ryokan. Very clean room, amazing service and delicious breakfast. We did not get to try the kaiseki dinner as the restaurant was fully booked but read good reviews about it. One thing to note is that there are very little street lamps in the area and it gets really dark at night, so getting a car is highly preferable. All things considered, I would definitely recommend this place!

Highly recommend this hotel. Room has its own onsen tubs (both indoor and outdoor) and staff are all so friendly and helpful. Room is spacious, food is delicious, etc…

The only downside…It is a bit far from the Yufuin station and taxi is a bit hard to find if you are not coming from the station.

However, overall it is still a very pleasant stay and we love the hotel!

We just used the onsen, without staying at the Ryokan. It was 800¥ per person and it was absolutely worth it. We went into the light blue open air bath which was wonderful. The water was a good temperature, although I think it could have maybe even been a little hotter. (Although I do prefer not warm enough over uncomfortably hot, so I didnt mind). The Highlight was definitely the beautiful view you got from the onsen, as Mt. Yufu was partially visible and it felt like properly bathing in nature. The area felt clean and tidy and Body Soap, Shampoo and Conditioner are provided to wash with after exiting. Highly recommend visiting this Onsen!

This was quite the walk, and I wouldn't suggest a taxi as the roads are very full of people, creating a lot of congestion.

However, I would definitely recommend it. We went here for the day use hot springs, and it was very empty around lunch time. The scenery was beautiful, it was very quiet,  and there was a very nice breeze to help you cool off. Most relaxing hour of my trip!

I was quite sad most of the snacks were sold out already by this time.

Good quality 100% free flowing hotspring with a quiet and clean environment. However the location is not very accessible, i don't think it's possible to walk there without getting lost and it's gonna be a tough uphill climb. I took a taxi there from Yufuin station and after taking a bath walked to Kinrin lake and the main shopping street then back to the station for my day trip from Fukuoka. I picked this place because I wanted to avoid the more popular onsens that are often crowded with tourists. View is not as nice as others but no regrets. You can still see abit of the mountain from the open air bath. There was no one in the bath when I arrived, and only one person came after me. There are onsen hard boiled eggs for 100yen each, it's worth trying.

Visited the onsen as a day visitor when the streets of Yufuin were packed with traffic and people. The onsen was a pleasant 25-30 min walk uphill from the town and not at all crowded. The bath is very large and half under cover and half open to the sky and a very pleasant breeze. The summit of Mt Yufu was almost visible under a cloud cap. Bath water was a great temperate and a bit cloudy and mineral-rich. Recommended!

Went for a day onsen. Virgin onsen experience and it was enjoyable.

Very simple system, just buy a ticket from the machine and drop it into the basket on the counter and walk into the onsen.

Split into male or female onsen.

Very refreshing

Quite a distance to walk from Yufuin station but it's definitely quieter, not many people. (It was just me when I used it, so it felt luxurious)

data.formatted_address: 2967-13 川上 湯布院町 Yufu, Oita 879-5102, Japan
data.name: Norman Rockwell Yufuin Museum

reviews.text: Norman Rockwell museum. I don't know about this artist (do enjoy going to gallery). This is a history of his works and visiting, im really impressed!! Losses one star due to the fact these very little English (it's fine by me) and only a limited number of post cards (the second point was the main reason it lost a star). But if your in the area and like interesting painting, then go!! Also no photos allowed!!

A very memorable visit to an American artist museum in a rather remote and wonderful area of Japan.
It was rather charming, but so was everything we saw in Japan!
good
When I went to Yufuin, I went to the museum several times, but it was always closed. What time is it open? I'd like to try it once...but it's a shame🤣

I think it would be a good idea to visit the museum with the understanding that it is a privately run museum.
However, it is believed to be the only place in Japan where you can enjoy many paintings by Norman Rockwell.
You can feel the thoughts (heavy?) of the person who is probably the director, in a good way.
Happy I peeked in during my way up the road. Hosted by very kind curators. Very much enjoyed my stay.

I visited various art museums in Yufuin, and I was very satisfied because I was able to see many works at reasonable prices.
The curator will explain things very kindly. It was a cold season, so they turned on the heating.
Each item is said to be part of the current director's collection, and if he finds something he likes, he buys it. It seems that the company is being run in the footsteps of the director who founded it.

From the large window, we could see snow-capped Mt. Yufu. The scenery was also nice.

It was a heartwarming time to see them off and ask them to come again if they liked.

Museums have the impression of being difficult to enter, but it was great to be able to enjoy it in a home-like atmosphere.

thank you very much!

It was a small museum that displayed paintings collected by individuals.
There is no parking lot, but I was told that no one would complain if I parked in a vacant lot nearby, so I parked there.
There aren't many paintings, but the owner explained things to me in a calm manner, and I could see Mt. Yufu from the window, which gave me a nice feeling about the space.
Admission fee is 300 yen and coffee included is 500 yen, so be sure to enjoy some delicious coffee.
A community-type multi-functional private art gallery with a very unique space~~

This is a small art museum located at the back of a large art museum called Artesio.
Although it's an art museum, it doesn't feel formal, and has a more casual feel.
The exhibits include many works by people connected to Kyushu, ranging from oil paintings to watercolors and ceramics.
All items are said to have been assembled by the owner.
I don't usually talk to museum owners, but the owner was so friendly that we chatted for about an hour here.
Along the way, I saw Hideko Hosoe's posters and photo catalogue.
We had a great time with coffee.
The pottery is said to be the work of the owner. It was a really nice curved piece!

I found this while cycling around Yufuin.
A frog is looking at Mt.Yufudake happily.

data.name: 湯布院（峯先）キリシタン墓群

reviews.text:
I didn't know that there was such a historical site in Yufuin. Stone tablets with crosses engraved on them were lined up here and there in the general cemetery. I did a little research and found that there was a period of about 30 years when freedom of religion was allowed, so it appears to be the graves of people who lived out their natural lives and were buried there. After it was banned, it became a village for hidden Christians, and it seems that they were hidden by burying gravestones, and later generations dug them up and looked after them (some of them had different shapes, so they were brought in after the punishment). Others?)
I entered through a narrow road that the navigation system didn't recommend, so I got a little lost trying to get to the place where the sign was. I bother you.
It is impossible for regular cars to pass through.
Please always watch over us.

It's at a dead end between people's houses. There is no parking lot, but is it possible to park a few cars on the street?
There are gravestones dotted around the bamboo forest on the steep slope. This is probably a common cemetery in this area since ancient times.
The gravestones are a mix of old and very recent ones. There are no markings on which tombstones belong to Christians, so it is impossible for an amateur to tell at a glance.
The road is narrow and impossible to drive. It seems to be located in a general cemetery, but the grave collapsed due to an earthquake, so it is best to avoid visiting it.
There is no entrance! But somehow I got there. I wish I had studied more history. Even though I lived nearby, I didn't know anything about it.

Best place to hang around while waiting for your train. Relaxing architecture with a mountain view.
Yufu City Tourism Information staff are very accommodating and friendly.

The tourist information center is right next door to the Yufuin train station.  If you exit from the station it will be to your right past the toilet.

You can't miss it as the unique building architecture sets it apart from the surrounding typical buildings.  It is a very pretty architecture with curving exposed wood.

Plenty of seats upstairs to rest while waiting for your train or staying out of the elements.  Upstairs also has outdoor seating at the balcony.
Lovely architecture and staff speak English. You can rent a bike here and store your luggage. Also there is wifi!

this tourist center building is the best one I have seen in Kyushu so far. It is designed by a famous architect (Ban) and the interior on the wood works are amazing, it is really such a nice eye feast to enjoy this building free of charge.

For the information, there isn’t much, they do offer some walking map, that’s all. That’s why I had to deduct one star, 😞

A lovely architectural building for tourists. Maps readily available. Free seating while waiting for train or just to stay warm from the cold wind out there. There is service for baggage storage & it is reasonably priced. Toilets are available too. Look out to Mount Yufu from the upper floor.

data.formatted_address: Japan, 〒879-5102 Oita, Yufu, Yufuinchō Kawakami, １５０３ ３YUFUIN FLORAL VILLAGE内
data.name: 湯布院のフクロウの森

reviews.text: Animals in the „village” are treated poorly. Owls have their legs tied to a rack and cannot move. The rest of the animals have extremely tiny enclosures.
A really great experience and you can pet the owls! Only 700yen

I’m regretful to write that I can’t recommend this place. These may well be owls bred for display and not taken from the wild, but they’re not a domesticated species like
the humble cat. Owls are highly sophisticated nocturnal and crepuscular predators whose nature is to hunt and breed in the wild, not be poked, prodded and photographed by gormless tourists during the day. They’re all chained to their perches with a sign in English comically claiming that they’re allowed to go free at night, now if I were one of those unfortunate owls I’d hightail it out of there at the very first opportunity. There are warnings to not touch the newer arrivals until they settle as they may night bite - I don't blame them at all.

One of very few chances to get up close and interact with owls. A few of the owls aren't used to people yet and might bite you. Great experience but a bit expensive for such a small area (about 15 birds are exhibited)

Owls are chained on short chains to branches, forced to be awake during daylight hours whilst people take pictures and pet them. This is inhumane. Other animals that are normally wild in England are in small cages also, whole experience was very upsetting.

A zoo in Rakutenchi. Chickens, peacocks and ducks. You can feed friendly animals such as meerkats, tortoises, goats, and donkeys. A Honda monkey bike was reused and turned into a merry-go-round. Surprised. It was crowded with families, with activities such as aerial bicycles and mini water chutes. Hell steamed vegetables were also cheap. Go for it! An amusement park with the smell of the Showa era.

You can interact with flamingos and peacocks.
Admission to the bird park is free if you enter the park.
If you want to feed it, the feeding fee is 100 yen.
It's a little scary when a flamingo approaches,
Do the birds know that?
It's okay because I'm not that gutsy.
Although there are few places, the children love it. There is food at the entrance (100 yen)
There are five types of birds here: ducks, peacocks, flamingos, chickens, and ducks. It was fun because I got to see all kinds of birds.

data.formatted_address: 5418 Ōga, Hiji, Hayami District, Oita 879-1504, Japan
data.name: Ougami Fukae Gyokou no asaichi

reviews.text: Definitely worth visiting but it was one of the markets which are too good to tell to your friends.

I think it depends on the day, but there weren't many types of fish. But I think it's good because it's fresh and cheap. However, depending on the item, it seems like you'll have to buy a box. I bought a small portion of sea cucumber. It was very delicious and the drinks went well. I will visit again.

From Fukuoka
Starting early on weekdays, aiming for the morning market that starts at 7:30 a.m.
I ran the car.

Until the auction, the general public can see it up close.
Auctioned fish can be purchased at a 30% premium through a broker.

It's not a big market, but you can see the auction scene.
Unfortunately, there were very few fish due to the stormy weather, but I enjoyed the atmosphere.Next time, I would like to try and catch a lot of fish.

The parking lot was spacious and the restrooms were clean.
We are closed on Sundays.

Even ordinary people can buy fish from brokers.
Broker's auction price + 30% commission (fee) = purchase price
The general public can see the fish directly until the auction starts.
Although it is called Ogami fishing port, it is generally better to call it [Fukae].

Even the general public can purchase it!
However, it cannot be purchased directly.
You probably won't be able to participate in the auction.
There are several wholesalers like ○○ Shoten, so we buy what they bid on.
The auction begins at around 7:20, and items that have been dropped are displayed at the front in the order they were dropped.
Please note that the price will be 30% more than the displayed price! (Example: 1000 yen → 1300 yen)
Closed on Wednesdays and Sundays, the best days to visit are if the waves are calm the day before (not raining or windy), the catch the next day will increase significantly.
The size and price are incomparable to supermarkets, so if you only have 2,000 yen, you won't have to worry about missing dinner.
If you want to snack on sashimi, 1000 yen might be enough.
Once the fish is sold, they also sell vegetables, so if you are interested in that, please do.
And one point of advice.
If in doubt, buy it. There are many customers, so they end up buying it before they can decide.
If you see a good product lined up, let's call out to them immediately.
The place isn't that noisy, and the staff are all kind, so feel free to ask what you want to know (of course, if it's crowded, keep it short).
it's the best!
*The yellowtail in the photo was 87cm long, average fat, and dying but still alive and cost 1,300 yen (original price).
A charming street of souvenirs, crafts, foods, ice cream, etc to stroll down. So many things to enjoy with so little room to fill.
Nice walking street
Streets with shops selling souvenirs and lots of food. The town is cute.
The city is very beautiful, cute. I like it. I want to come again. Lots of food, beautiful views everywhere.
Lots of diverse, fun shops with street food!!

There are not many stores open but there is one great butcher where we bought different cuts of wagyu beef for Yakiniku and bought karage and rice balls from the opposite store.

We bought shashimi from the fish monger - our meals for the day sorted , much cheaper than esting at the restaurants and better quality food.

If you're around Beppu, want to get some good food and don't mind doing a bit of cooking, book a guest house like J-Hoppers where there's a functioning kitchen and a good space for dining, I highly recommend going to the fresh local market, get some good quality ingredients for better meals.
Buy drinks from the supermarkets, save half the price from the vending machines.
It is unfortunate how this place is becoming a shutter street now. But there is a dried fish store which sells excellent products which is still there.

This is your local market to get your grocery done. Come during lunch time and eat some fresh fish at the market. This is true Beppu experience.

Don’t forget to visit the tea shop and sample some of the local Beppu teas
Most stores are closed or out of business and only a several that were open. Noda deli shop seemed to be quite popular selling veggie delis and fried thing.

Very local. May b a bit rough around the edges, but is a kind of fun and interesting market place. Most of the shops have been there for years.
The food take out shops are very popular with the locals. Inexpensive and good.🍴😊
If you can go to this sacred spot on a rainy and foggy spring day, you will experience solitude and forest wisdom. The bamboo forest behind the shrine is simply divine.
Hiked up at 7am on a rainy morning. I was amazed how quiet and calm the shrine was. Felt totally cleansed spiritually and physically!
Discreet and quiet. The bamboo forest is beautiful and the view down to the town is amazing. Only thing is that there’s no personnel here so no way to get goshuin.

Went here in the summer because it really close to our hotel. It was an uphill climb and worth the walk. A bit unkempt but I enjoyed the eerie vibe of it all. A cool place to go and definitely not a lot of tourists. There were also seats around the area if you would like to hang around for a little bit. A lot of bamboo behind the shrine. Free entrance.

Took me about 35 minutes from the train station. Visited in Jan 2023. It was serene & tranquil to the extent of eerie as no one was around and it felt abit unkempt. Probably better to visit on one sunny day in the spring or fall.
Nice station where you can take pics of classic trains, when i visited they also had art space aka waiting room.
Waiting room for train passengers with various art exhibits.
A waiting room for passengers, also provide tourists information and art exhibition.

Along with the atmosphere of the town, the station building and art hall at Yufuin Station, the service of the station staff is top-notch. He explained the Yufuin no Mori train and even exchanged seat reservations! It was a great train journey with comfortable seats in a comfortable vehicle. The whole family has become Yufuin fans.

reviews.author_name: Hongkonger inFukuoka 香港人在福岡
reviews.text:
[Yufu train (ゆふ) #Yufuin no Mori🚉] Yufuin is a hot spring resort that is famous for its rich natural scenery, elegant and unique culture, and warm and hospitable customs.

The Yufuin no Mori train's interior is decorated with the warmth of wood, and you can feel a resort-like atmosphere the moment you board the train.

This is the first time for the editor to ride in Yufuin no Mori🚉The area around this station feels like being in a theater, because the entire station is so beautiful, and there are many shopping streets around it. Although there are only local tourists for the time being due to the epidemic, the charm of Yufuin is still there😊

This time I made a reservation for several types of bento 🍱👀🚊Scenic food bento Ichiraku 😋🤤 From top quality Wagyu beef 🍱 to 🍙🍘🥡, I am very satisfied 😆
We thought it’s closed as there’s no one at the reception.  A man popped out and switched on the lights. The space and the sculptures are both great despite in needs of cleaning and maintenance.

Mr. Sueda is already over 90. If your wife is healthy, she should be 90. It is not possible to take care of the inside of the building. The person sitting and dozing off near the entrance looked like a work of art from the outside. The artist's aging appearance. It was good to go.

You can experience Hiroshi Hara's architecture. This piece contrasts with the black, closed-off exterior that references a herring hut, and the interior that lets in light to create a soft atmosphere.

The museum and the works resonate with each other, and the quality of the space is extremely high. You can face the work in silence. An art museum where the history of the artist's creative activities is transformed into architecture.

I went to Kinrinko Lake early in the morning.
It's a black building on the outside, but I couldn't see it because it was before opening.
If you are planning to go with some time left in the morning like me, please turn around.

I was here late February so it was fairly cold. I read online from the brochure that this is NOT the easiest trail, but from the Yufuin floral village it’s just a few minute walk. As compared to the other trail heads where we had to ride a bus.

It’s not the easiest to spot, but luckily I had google maps to show me where to find it. It’s not the most obviously marked so you need to stick to the trail just so you don’t get lost

The first few kilometers are just straight ascents but it gets easier from there and the views didn’t disappoint. I wouldn’t say it’s a beginner friendly trail but very rewarding. I remember seeing a few deers from afar and several birds that seemed rare.

A nice little adventure I won’t forget!

This trailhead is very accessible without car, just a 10min walk from Kinrin lake at Yufuin. The trade-off is that it's not as well marked as the main trailhead. I went up via this route and down via the main trailhead and took a bus back into town.

Just be careful to stick to the trails, it's a little hard to spot at times. Best to have your GPS maps ready as backup. Total took around 6 hours.

Great location for trekking at Mt.Yufu from the city center. This pass is well marked with colored ties.

You can trek to the mountain with light gears.
Mt.Yufu is relatively easy to trek at and you pass through a small stream from this mountain path.
The water from the stream is so clean and safe that you don't have to bring a lot of water if you take this path. You can refill your bottle and drink the water without filtering it

I saw some wild deers at the path too. There are some benches on the way to the top for trekkers to take a break or have lunch.

No free car parking at the trailhead.

What a beautiful trail. A huge variety of landscapes. This route starts from Yufuin itself (1.5 km away from train station, let's say). I had read before going that it's a problematic trail and not so well marked. To be honest I only had problems to find the way in one section, I will clarify to help you: after maybe half an hour or one hour depending on your rythm you will reach a forest considerably darker than the previous way you walked. You will recognize it because it is completely plain. After crossing this forest suddenly a landscape like Ireland's hills appears. At this point you have to turn left (at the end of the forest) and watch carefully for a signal (do not follow the concrete way as it leads to a dead end). The signal you are looking for is at your North West after forest's exit. The trail to the signal is not marked, however once you spot and reach it, the way becomes clearer and clearer. A good idea here is to just follow a pipe on the ground you will see some meters after the signal. Afterwards, both of Yufu peaks can be seen, so it's relatively easy to follow the way until the joining with main trail. Hope this helps you and enjoy the hike.

It is recommended to ascend Yubudake East Peak from the front trailhead (the terrain of the main peak is more dangerous, so careful consideration is required), and then exit from the west trailhead. The west route is less popular and has a longer path, but the scenery along the way is varied and well worth visiting. There are places like The prairie and beautiful forests of Hehuan Mountain. Be sure to download the Japan YAMAP offline map first, it is very easy to use.

An amateur mountain climber, who is elderly and has been working only at a desk for several decades, decided to climb the mountain alone for the purpose of hiking. I climbed it at around 10am on January 9, 2024. I actually started climbing around 9:30, but by the time I reached the first bench, I realized I didn't have my wallet, so I returned to the parking lot. When I got back to the car and searched the inside of the car, I thought I had dropped it, but when I looked out the window, I saw that someone had put a rubber band on the inside of the mirror and found the contents of about 55,000 yen, credit card, driver's license, and cash. The card was also safe. I don't know who you are, but I would like to take this opportunity to thank you.
Climbing? Returning to the hike, I took a plastic bottle with about 7 minutes left in it, a mobile battery, cheap shoes for trekking, and wore regular clothing, including down jackets.
I have no mountain climbing experience, so the climb was really tough, and I couldn't see what was going to happen, so I thought about going home many times along the way, but I could see that my family, who enjoy mountain climbing as a hobby, would call me pathetic. I decided to take a few steps before stopping and taking a rest, and in the end it took about two and a half hours, but I was able to climb the eastern peak. I was worried about snow at this time of year, but there was only a little snow left near the summit, so there was no problem. Of course, if I climb up, I have to come down, but I slip on fallen leaves and stones and fall dozens of times.Most of the time, my feet flow in front of me and I fall backwards, but sometimes my feet flow backwards, and my knees fall in a big way. I hit the rock hard and the moment I hit it, I might not be able to walk! ? Although I felt anxious, I managed to get down in about an hour and a half. The purpose of this trip was to use my body a little, so I think I achieved that goal.

I never thought that my first time climbing Mt. Yufu would be covered in snow. Yufudake has a beautiful appearance. Honestly, I think autumn is the best time to go. Next up is the fresh greenery of spring. I think it gets too hot in the summer with little shade, and if there's snow it becomes much more difficult.
The mountain trail is relatively easy to climb. Nishimine...that side is clearly more than intermediate level. I think there are Kusariba and Minewatari. Toho is at a level that is safe for beginners. However, since the overall route is long and the round trip is slow, it will take 5 hours, so from a low mountain level it clearly requires physical strength and strength.
It might be a good idea to try it after climbing at least a few places. Also, as for equipment, it is better to have trekking shoes. There are many places with rocks and stones, so if you wear a low cut, your ankles will get hurt. Also, the harder the sole, the easier it will be. I think you don't need to wear mountain climbing gear except in winter. The upper part requires using your hands, so I think having a pole would get in the way, but for the most part I felt it was easier with a pole. About half of the people were using stock. As for gloves...I think it depends on your preference. In winter, it would be better to wear gloves and a hat.

┈┈┈┈┈┈┈┈┈┈
I wrote a lot...
To put it more simply, I get the impression that it's a mountain where you don't have to worry about equipment as much, except when it's snowing.

reviews.author_name: おいちゃん!熊本で単身赴任中
reviews.text:
If you don't have time, I recommend going to the east peak instead of visiting the west peak. From the summit, you can see Mt. Tsurumi and Beppu Bay to the east, Mt. Sobo to the south, the Kuju Mountain Range to the southwest, and Mt. Aso, giving you a wonderful view.
There is a chain on the west peak, but there are no dangerous areas on the east peak. There is a suitable place to rest just before the summit.
Based on the reference time in the guidebook, it takes 2 hours and 40 minutes one way from the main trailhead (not including breaks). It just keeps going up. Plan on 6 to 8 hours round trip, including breaks. The Obachi tour has quite a difference in elevation and takes an additional hour.
There are no restrooms, shops, or evacuation huts at the summit. A must-have drink.
There is a large parking lot at the front trailhead.

One of the peaks of Mt. Yufudake, which is characterized by the rock that protrudes from the top.
It is easier to climb than Nishimine, so some people seem to choose this route depending on their ability. This one has a more mountaintop feeling.

I climbed it on the way back from Cantu to Beppu. Although there are some rocks on the mountain trail, it is very easy to climb. Rather than being surrounded by dense trees, the path is bright with sunlight filtering through the trees. The view from the top is also nice. Next time I'll be climbing Nishimine and other mountains wearing stretch pants. I recommend it.

Our first experience of driving our own car directly in the zoo! Totally different experience. Animals aren’t exactly caged. They’re more happy and very enthusiastic when the shuttle bus comes by (people on the bus will feed).

Amazing safari bus tour and feeding frenzy😆
The staffs are so nice, and the animals are well-arranged in separate area.  Wonderful tour!
Tips: You’ll probably get first round bus tour if you arrive before 8:30.

Since we had children with us, one of our itineraries included a self-drive visit to the Kyushu Nature Zoo. Not only the kids, but the adults were also extremely excited. The tour lasted for about an hour, and we got to see various animals up close.

Due to the self-drive arrangement, it was not allowed to open the windows or get out of the car midway.

It was definitely a fantastic experience for everyone.

I almost skipped this place and I’m glad I did not! We enjoyed ourselves so much here. I’ve never seen a lion so upclose before. And a big bear just walked past my car.

The kids enjoyed the experience! We just drove our car in and the animals get up close to you.

Spent about 30-40 mins in the park and it’s such a nice experience driving in the park to view the animals.

Jungle Bus is a must if you visit here, the ride is informative and you can have very close contact to rare animals, you can even feed some of them.

For the rest of the Safari, honestly it’s a bit small but still great fun, many cute little animals for feeding and cuddling.

data.formatted_address: Kinrin Lake, Yufuincho Kawakami, Yufu, Oita 879-5102, Japan
data.name: Kinrin Lake

reviews.text:
We loved this place, the quiet surrounding with cute cafe, which we also highly recommend.
I am not sure the lake will look as great due with bad weather as it looked lovely today with sun.
Yet, if you are in Beppu, it is worth to make a trip for half of the day and enjoy the views :)

Small lake but pretty with mountain in the background. I came once in the afternoon and once in the early morning. It’s way better without the afternoon crowd and you get to see the morning mist if you’re early enough
I came in the late evening and the lake is calm and peaceful. We had the lake to ourselves. Its an easy short walk around the lake. The parking at the lake area is expensive.
OK lake - quite small. Nothing to do here when shops are all closed. Can pay a visit if you are already in Yufuin floral village

Visit before Sunrise, you will see the beautiful lake with mist , peaceful with very few people around. Only pity was  cafes opens late morning, so don’t get to enjoy a cup of coffee by the lake at early morning.
It feels totally different when we visit again in the late morning - a lot of tourists and you hardly get a quiet spot along the lake.

data.name: The Village 由布院 温泉グランピング

reviews.text:
Good Service, very clean.
The tent is well equipped and nice to enjoy the star view at night.
Staff prepared the food for barbecue and get all the things ready for us. They provided a detailed guideline and instructions on how to cook each dishes, so it’s easy to handle.
The private hotspring is really good too!
The best part is the onsen and the walk to lake Kinrin. There are so many unique little shops along the way. But Kinrin lake is a bit over rated, nothing much to see and not that big.
Glamping experience.

Five people used it: my parents, husband, and 0-year-old daughter.
You can enjoy glamping comfortably in the middle of nature.
Everything was prepared so I was able to travel light. It was barrier-free from the parking lot to the room, so it was easy to reach the room even with a stroller.
There are plenty of amenities, but there are no pajamas, so I had to prepare my own.
BBQ and breakfast use locally sourced ingredients. It was a system where you could bring a set of items prepared in a carry cart to your room at a time of your choice. There are recipes, so you don't have to do the dishes and it's easy.
There is also a natural hot spring where you can slowly relieve your fatigue.
There is a dedicated BBQ tent, so you can enjoy it even on rainy days.
There are many services and facilities for families with small children, so it is also recommended for families with children. My parents were also overjoyed and said, ``It's a rare experience like this!''

We used this accommodation with a wide range of generations, from grandparents to grandchildren, and the whole family was very satisfied with the accommodation!
All the staff were very kind and polite, so I was able to enjoy glamping without any inconvenience!
The bed is soft and comfortable, and the view is great, so you can have a great time ^_^
We even start the BBQ for you, so all you have to do is cook!
Just return it when you're done!
The children will be very happy as they will also give out fireworks ^_^
The hot springs are also thick and will make your skin glow.
Being able to enjoy the large public bath privately was also very comfortable and I was able to relax slowly!
There is also play equipment and scenic swings, so kids can have fun without getting bored!
The main street of Yufuin and Sagiridai are also very close, so the location is very good.
It's a place I'd like to use again!
Thank you to all the staff for your kindness ^_^

If you love Japanese architecture and quiet walks, this is a nice place to visit! There’s tons of temples in the area and a few cafes. Things seemed to be pretty closed- possibly the season, possibly because of covid. Still a nice place to wander and admire traditional architecture.

I got lost and found myself strolling here at night.
It really felt like time traveling, i really recommend visiting

Maybe it was my mistake not to use googlemaps or pass by the tourist information center, however I was wandering the big area being clueless which street was actually Nioza Road. Lol
The streets were almost deserted so it was very quiet. There were few people around. It was nice to see different parts of the old town. It’s almost like an adventure when you don’t know where to actually go.
Interesting architecture, friendly.

Hmm, there's a much better atmosphere here than in Kyoto...
There is a decent life there, but there is no created atmosphere for tourists. But they also have an attitude of accepting outsiders. Great sense of balance.

This narrow street and the curves on the slope.
I can't stand it anymore! Adorable! Excited!

Usuki is a really nice town.
A quiet little temple honouring strong, long-standing trees against time, and special breeds of adorable cats could be found in all corners!
Didn’t go too far in as I wasn’t sure if this was ok to enter as there wasn’t any signs and there was a guardhouse. Looked like a little temple
Spacious place, clean and tidy, I just wanted to see the architecture, and it was pretty good. Not much else to do at a shrine but admire the building techniques.
Walked pass by in the morning. Very pretty shrine and very quiet
There is no any description for foreign travelers as usual in Japan. However I can't see any specific things here.

It is worth to walk behind the Kirin lake to visit this “water torri”. ⛩️⛩️⛩️
You can see the Kirin lake in different angles.
Really great spot for photography.

A small - pretty Shinto shrine on the bank of Kirin Lake in Yufuin, Oita Prefecture. The small main hall faces the lake. There is a small chair that we can see "floating torii" or a Shinto gate in the water. It's very clam and beautiful.

Very nice place to have a morning walk.
Recommend to go on winter morning to have the best misty view.

A shrine situated right next to the Kirin lake. Serene & tranquil. Simply phenomenal~
How to pay respect at shrine: first, put in the coin (preferably ¥5, go-en, simply means establishing a connection with the deity), then bow twice, clap your hands twice or ring the bell if there is one - this means to chase away evil spirits, then offer your silent prayer to the god (kami-sama) and end with a bow.

The Mog Champ sends his regards.

You can have nice overview of Kinrin Lake if you walk over to this side and around the Tenso shrine. It's a standard and quiet shrine compared to the big ones around Japan but it's clean and nicely maintained.

Thanks for the nice location!

Mogliest Regards,
Your Mog Champ

Rather run down and not very much to do, just a fancy parking lot at the moment. Albeit a parking lot in a convenient location.
Most memorable thing i did here was feed some cats. I noticed some poor malnourished kittens (one with an eye infection to boot), so I went to the local conbini to get them some kibble. But I really hope they'll be caught and spayed/neutered, because right now they're rather pitiful...

Would be cool if the old buildings were restored, and maybe allow people to see the inside architecture of these former wonders.

Only in Oita for a few days walked around a lot came across this and was interesting. A local was there on hand to explain much history about the Ruins, gave us some postcards too. Interesting to see the markets going on as well.
Near the Oita Station about 15 minutes walking. Small and compact castle ruin with rocks wall still good conditions. Good place for jogging in the morning.
Beautiful views in the center of the city, but still so peaceful.
Nice place to drop a visit if you take a walk in town

data.formatted_address: Japan, 〒878-0402 大分県竹田市直入町大字長湯
data.name: 山野城（朽網城）

reviews.text: If you read ``Walking through the famous castles of Kyushu [Oita and Kumamoto edition]'', you will be able to know the whole story. The local information board has almost no hints, so when I went there for the first time, I just walked around the area around the sign, the so-called "Nishinomaru." Yamano Castle is a gigantic castle with a total length of nearly 800 meters. There are many attractions, including the westernmost Horikiri ``Ichimanda-bori'', which is reminiscent of the Ohori-kiri of Miyazaki Prefecture's Miyako-gun Castle, as well as large-scale Horikiri in various places, and beautiful shaved areas here and there. Near the eastern end, there is also a place that looks like a defense line with a combination of horikiri, vertical moat, and horizontal moat. Please come and try walking there.

There is a paved road right up to the castle ruins, so it is a very easy castle to climb. There are stone monuments and information boards on the side of the road. This castle is a city-designated historic site.

It's fairly easy to enter from Green Road.
There is a flat area where a castle would have been,
That's all.
If you go up the road a little more
There is a lot of slightly carbonated spring water.
That one is recommended
There is nothing special about it, just a signboard and a stone monument. It is located on the forest road to Imamizu carbonated spring.
It's Yamashiro Ato, so you won't know unless there's a monument.

A beautiful train station. We took the train from Fukuoka and then to Beppu. There is a public toilet on the left of the station and plenty of coin lockers/coin changing machine. Also walking distance to our hotel and to nearby attractions. Can see the mountain from here as well.
Beautiful train station. Modern design contrasts vividly with the traditional train design. Worth seeing

A small train station with frequent train service connecting Yufuin to Fukuoka, Beppu, or Oita which makes day trips possible.

Great location to access places of interest in Yufuin.  No further connecting bus is needed.  You can explore Yufuin by walking right from the station toward Kin Rin lake.

Toilet and outdoor seating are to the right as you exit the station.  There is a foot bath but I believe it's not free and you have to pay fee.

There are foot baths tub in Yufu station. When you get there pm 4:00 on January, you can see the sunset and upcoming train. Foot bath fee is 200 yen per person and it's very helpful to relaese the tiredness of your foot. They give us new towels and postcards after foot bath.

Station located at the start of the main street that leads you to all the shops and hotels. There’s lockers, toilets and a taxi stand just outside. Near the bus station and there are quite a few restaurants and shops around. Also a drug store nearby. No automated gate so a conductor will be there to verify tickets.

data.formatted_address: Japan, 〒879-5104 大分県由布市湯布院町中川１１２０
data.name: Yufuin Garden Hotel

reviews.text:
What an enjoyable stay! Grandma, kids and dogs all had fun, and for the price the dinner buffet was spectacular.  Steak, chicken, pork, sushi, crab legs, and all the other less important items (salad) were also great.

The staff was very friendly and helpful. Wish we would have stayed longer. Next time we will.

The area is beautiful, right where I want to be: away from the main tourist stream and traffic.
A lovely clean and warm dog friendly hotel.

I used it for the first time.
You can see Mt. Yufu from your room👌
Mt. Yufu is perfect from the dog run 👌
Yufudake is perfect even from the bath 👌
I have never seen a place where Mt. Yufu is not obstructed by buildings, etc.
This is a great location if the weather is nice 😊
Both the evening buffet and the morning buffet were delicious.
Yufuin is a hot spring as expected♨️
The staff seems to be paying attention to various things, which I think is wonderful.
I'm sure I'll come back to help you again 😊

The location is a little far from the center of Yufuin (about 10 minutes by car), but it was nice to be able to see the mountains nearby! I was especially satisfied with the dinner buffet! I was very happy that there were crabs, steaks, etc., and that I was able to make hotpot again! The taste is also perfect!
Although we couldn't go to the buffet venue with our dog, we informed the staff and we took turns, so we were able to enjoy the meal without leaving our dog alone in the room! It was very easy to stay because they were flexible!
Since I was with my dog, we took advantage of the private bath, which was also very clean and we had a lot of fun! Also, there are various dog meal menus, so I ordered twice for breakfast and dinner, and both seemed so delicious that I finished them in seconds. It was very helpful that you could bring it to your room.

A hotel where you can stay with your dog.
large dog,
A dog run for small dogs is attached. Humans have family baths,
There are times when you are temporarily not allowed to enter.
The hot water is only available in Yufuin and is very good.

data.name: アルプスの少女ハイジの泉

reviews.text:
Alps girl theme stores
It is special, not easily else where
Terrible tourist trap with animals in cages verging on abuse - goats on hot pavement in 34 degrees.

Don't expect much.
It's just crowded. The smell of goat poop is amazing...
Artificial course...

A good store for Heidi lovers.
Only here is a different space.

Uninteresting tourist trap. To summarize the place, you have to imagine animals in cages, Ghibli, Heidi goodies and little cars for the children. Nothing to do with the place but it attracts tourists. All that’s missing is a maneki-neko at the entrance to complete the picture. I obviously advise against it.

data.formatted_address: Japan, 〒879-5113 Oita, Yufu, Yufuinchō Kawanishi, 字栗谷１７５５−３７
data.name: YUFUIN HOGONEKO FOREST

reviews.text:
I visited the pre-opening.
I want to help the owner's rescued cat. This is a wonderful attempt to give form to this idea.
The atmosphere is great and it's a place I want to go to regularly.
Did the Canopy course with our 5 and 7yr old. It was challenging but so much fun! The  kids had a blast and the zip slide was the best ending to each course! Staff were very helpful and friendly.
My sun (5 years old, 120cm) enjoyed a lot!  Great courses and friendly instructors.
Fun place for kids and adults alike. Buy ticket in advance.
Very fun time for groups the ziplines are great and the price is fair however if your looking for a challenging course this probably isn't for you
Love it. I choose the Advanture and a little bit scary because it is quite high - 12m above the ground. But after that it is so much funnn
